name: git-graph
description: View a Git Graph of your repository, and perform Git actions from the graph.

git-graph.autoCenterCommitDetailsView.description: Automatically center the commit details view when it is opened.

git-graph.combineLocalAndRemoteBranchLab.description: Combine local and remote branch labels if they refer to the same branch, and are on the same commit.

enumDescriptions: Show the Commit Details View inline with the graph
Show the Commit Details View docked to the bottom of the Git Graph view
git-graph.commitDetailsViewLocation.description: Specifies where the Commit Details View is rendered in the Git Graph view.

name.title: Name of pattern
name.description: Name used to reference the pattern in the 'Branches' dropdown

glob.title: Glob pattern
glob.description: The Glob Pattern <glob-pattern>, as used in 'git log --glob=<glob-pattern>'. For example: heads/feature/*

git-graph.customBranchGlobPatterns.description: An array of Custom Branch Glob Patterns to be shown in the 'Branches' dropdown. Example: [{"name": "Feature Requests", "glob": "heads/feature/*"}]

enumDescriptions: Show the date and time, for example "19 Mar 2019 21:34"
Show the date only, for example "19 Mar 2019"
Show relative times, for example "5 minutes ago"
git-graph.dateFormat.description: Specifies the date format to be used in the date column of Git Graph.

enumDescriptions: Use the author date of a commit
Use the committer date of a commit
git-graph.dateType.description: Specifies the date type to be displayed throughout Git Graph.

git-graph.defaultColumnVisibility.description: An object specifying the default visibility of the Date, Author & Commit columns. Example: {"Date": true, "Author": true, "Commit": true}

git-graph.fetchAvatars.description: Fetch avatars of commit authors and committers. By enabling this setting, you consent to commit author and committer email addresses being sent GitHub, GitLab or Gravatar, depending on the repositories remote origin.

git-graph.graphColours.description: Specifies the colours used on the graph.

enumDescriptions: Use smooth curves when transitioning between branches on the graph
Use angular lines when transitioning between branches on the graph
git-graph.graphStyle.description: Specifies the style of the graph.

git-graph.initialLoadCommits.description: Specifies the number of commits to initially load.

git-graph.loadMoreCommits.description: Specifies the number of commits to load when the "Load More Commits" button is pressed (only shown when more commits are available).

git-graph.maxDepthOfRepoSearch.description: Specifies the maximum depth of subfolders to search when discovering repositories in the workspace. Note: Sub-repos are not automatically detected when searching subfolders, however they can be manually added by running the command "Git Graph: Add Git Repository" in the Command Palette.

enumDescriptions: Open Visual Studio Code Diff in the Active Pane
Open Visual Studio Code Diff beside the Active Pane
git-graph.openDiffTabLocation.description: Specifies which pane the Visual Studio Code Diff is opened in.

git-graph.openToTheRepoOfTheActiveTextEd.description: Open Git Graph to the repository containing the active Text Editor document.

enum: Branches (on the left) & Tags (on the right)
Branches (aligned to the graph) & Tags (on the right)
enumDescriptions: Show branch & tag labels on the left of the commit message in the 'Description' column.
Show branch labels on the left of the commit message in the 'Description' column, and tag labels on the right.
Show branch labels aligned to the graph in the 'Graph' column, and tag labels on the right in the 'Description' column.
git-graph.referenceLabelAlignment.description: Specifies how branch and tag reference labels are aligned for each commit.

git-graph.retainContextWhenHidden.description: Specifies if the Git Graph view Visual Studio Code context is kept when the panel is no longer visible (e.g. moved to background tab). Enabling this setting will make Git Graph load significantly faster when switching back to the Git Graph tab, however has a higher memory overhead.

git-graph.showCurrentBranchByDefault.description: Show the current branch by default when Git Graph is opened. Default: false (show all branches)

git-graph.showStatusBarItem.description: Show a Status Bar item which opens Git Graph when clicked.

git-graph.showUncommittedChanges.description: Show uncommitted changes (set to false to decrease load time on large repositories).

enumDescriptions: Show the 'View Git Graph' action on the title of SCM Providers
Show the 'View Git Graph' action in the 'More Actions...' menu on the title of SCM Providers
git-graph.sourceCodeProviderIntegrationL.description: Specifies where the 'View Git Graph' action appears on the title of SCM Providers.

enumDescriptions: Show a colour icon which suits most Visual Studio Code colour themes
Show a grey icon which suits Visual Studio Code colour themes that are predominantly grayscale
git-graph.tabIconColourTheme.description: Specifies the colour theme of the icon displayed on the Git Graph tab.

scripts.compile: npm run clean && npm run compile-src && npm run compile-web
scripts.package-and-install: npm run clean && vsce package && node ./.vscode/install-package.js
